intro: Cyrtandra coccinea var. timorensis, commonly known as the Timor red heliconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround its small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged in whorls around the stem. The flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly honeyeaters, making it an important component of the local ecosystem.
